thread_name: Withdraw was not confirmed but balance became 0
frequent_posters: harinij, bremaine1, bassmaxx, filomena_silva, arbabshujaat98, lenasemenkova, imagination7413
thread_text: Hi I tried to withdraw 490$ from my balance using payoneer two days back. While clicking on bank transfer i got a popup showing "there is a some problem in withdrawal " and this button was enabled “continue to withdraw”.As there was an error message I did not proceed to withdraw I closed and cancelled. But the status shows “Withdraw initiated” and my balance came to 0.This status is still “initiated” and no action after that. As I did not proceed to withdraw my amount should be in fiverr only.But it shows 0 now. How will I get my money back .I tried contacting customer support but no respond from them. Its been two days now. Anyone can help me with this. Thanks
reply_text:
It’s probably a pending charge or on hold for some reason. I remember it being a bit slower with Payoneer when it came to getting paid. But, Fiverr has it on record, so if it’s stuck somewhere, they should be able to get it sent your way.
Have you checked your Payoneer account just in case to see if you received any messages/notifications? I’d also double check your email to see if you got anything about it.
One thing I thought of, is that maybe it’s a graphical glitch you’re seeing and the money is still there ready to be withdrawn. If so, signing out and back in might fix it. Or clearing your browser cache. To me, it sounds like it could be an issue like that, especially if you didn’t go through with the withdrawal.
Otherwise, I think it’s probably stuck on fiverr’s end, or there’s a hold for some reason.

I’ll appreciate your sincere guidance and help. Thanks in advance.

thread_text: I think that sellers should be able to apply discounts or manually lower the prices on their gigs and here comes the fun part - Remember the “Save” gig heart button? The buyers that saved the gig should then get a notification about the discount/lower price. That is a great reminder and a great chance for buyers to get something they want for a discount and a great way for sellers to do some more sells when they don’t have that much queued orders. It’s a smart idea that’ll benefit both buyers and sellers if implemented.
reply_text:
Too many sellers make the assumption people are cheap and seeking discounts. They aren’t. They are seeking excellence.
I do not want to actively encourage discount minded buyers. My focus is on quality and excellence, and priced accordingly.

thread_text: I think that sellers should be able to apply discounts or manually lower the prices on their gigs and here comes the fun part - Remember the “Save” gig heart button? The buyers that saved the gig should then get a notification about the discount/lower price. That is a great reminder and a great chance for buyers to get something they want for a discount and a great way for sellers to do some more sells when they don’t have that much queued orders. It’s a smart idea that’ll benefit both buyers and sellers if implemented.
reply_text:
Well, some people just can’t afford some services and of course - this will be optional. On one of my drawing gigs I have around 150 orders while the gig itself has been saved over 1800 times by potential buyers. What I suggested is a great idea if you think about it - the discounts are optional - if you don’t want to discount your gigs then you can avoid doing so.
It’s a great idea, because it will bring more traffic and revenue to the platform - If a certain service that a buyer saved gets discounted, a notification about the discount will appear. This way, the seller that decided to discount his gig will reach all the people that were already interest in his gig so he’ll definitely be getting new orders and the buyers will be able to get the service they wanted for a cheaper price (As they probably couldn’t afford it at the time). It’s an absolute win-win if you ask me.

thread_text: I think that sellers should be able to apply discounts or manually lower the prices on their gigs and here comes the fun part - Remember the “Save” gig heart button? The buyers that saved the gig should then get a notification about the discount/lower price. That is a great reminder and a great chance for buyers to get something they want for a discount and a great way for sellers to do some more sells when they don’t have that much queued orders. It’s a smart idea that’ll benefit both buyers and sellers if implemented.
reply_text:
worthforcheap:
On one of my drawing gigs I have around 150 orders while the gig itself has been saved over 1800 times by potential buyers.
Is there a way to see how many times your gig has been saved?

thread_text: I think that sellers should be able to apply discounts or manually lower the prices on their gigs and here comes the fun part - Remember the “Save” gig heart button? The buyers that saved the gig should then get a notification about the discount/lower price. That is a great reminder and a great chance for buyers to get something they want for a discount and a great way for sellers to do some more sells when they don’t have that much queued orders. It’s a smart idea that’ll benefit both buyers and sellers if implemented.
reply_text:
You’re applying product selling principles to commission selling. That’s a disaster waiting to happen.
It would mean inviting people who would prefer to hire you when you pay yourself less for labour and resources ie) scum buyers.
Good buyers understand three things:
You get what you pay for
They don’t trust the quality of people who think they need to be cheap in order to sell.
Lowering the price of goods just lowers your profit margin. Lowering the cost of services means you’re paying yourself less per hour to do them. Good buyers know that true professionals don’t voluntarily underpay themselves to get work.

thread_text: I think that sellers should be able to apply discounts or manually lower the prices on their gigs and here comes the fun part - Remember the “Save” gig heart button? The buyers that saved the gig should then get a notification about the discount/lower price. That is a great reminder and a great chance for buyers to get something they want for a discount and a great way for sellers to do some more sells when they don’t have that much queued orders. It’s a smart idea that’ll benefit both buyers and sellers if implemented.
reply_text:
juanitataylor:
Is there a way to see how many times your gig has been saved?
One easy way is to go to your gig page. The heart symbol with the numbers next to it represents the number of times your gig has been saved.
Your “cute illustration” gig, for example, has been saved a healthy 114 times.

thread_text: I know late last year i had an email in regards to Fiverr updating their Paypal agreement and sending an email out to everyone in regards to no fees. I don’t withdraw very often to Paypal and i’ve started using payoneer but when i do i still notice that the balance shown in my Fiverr let’s say there was £1000 and then i withdraw to Paypal and it shows as for example £980.75. Why is this if there are no Paypal fees?
reply_text:
Because the “no PayPal fees” only refers to the transaction fees PayPal used to take prior to this change when you withdrew your files from Fiverr to PayPal.
You still have to pay conversion fees and maybe others, depending on what you’re doing.

thread_text: I know late last year i had an email in regards to Fiverr updating their Paypal agreement and sending an email out to everyone in regards to no fees. I don’t withdraw very often to Paypal and i’ve started using payoneer but when i do i still notice that the balance shown in my Fiverr let’s say there was £1000 and then i withdraw to Paypal and it shows as for example £980.75. Why is this if there are no Paypal fees?
reply_text: Right, that’s what i thought (conversion fees). So i guess Payoneer works out cheaper at like a $3 fee for whatever the amount it seems.

thread_text: I know late last year i had an email in regards to Fiverr updating their Paypal agreement and sending an email out to everyone in regards to no fees. I don’t withdraw very often to Paypal and i’ve started using payoneer but when i do i still notice that the balance shown in my Fiverr let’s say there was £1000 and then i withdraw to Paypal and it shows as for example £980.75. Why is this if there are no Paypal fees?
reply_text:
From what I’ve calculated, it’s cheaper to use paypal up until about $200. $300 and up, it’s cheaper to do a bank transfer.
This is in part because I’m in the UK, so dollars need to be converted to pounds, which paypal charges for.

thread_text: I know late last year i had an email in regards to Fiverr updating their Paypal agreement and sending an email out to everyone in regards to no fees. I don’t withdraw very often to Paypal and i’ve started using payoneer but when i do i still notice that the balance shown in my Fiverr let’s say there was £1000 and then i withdraw to Paypal and it shows as for example £980.75. Why is this if there are no Paypal fees?
reply_text: Even for a smaller amount on Paypal say like $200 i still feel like Paypal takes about $10 off of it for converting where as the bank transfer option it looks like they only like $3

thread_text: I know late last year i had an email in regards to Fiverr updating their Paypal agreement and sending an email out to everyone in regards to no fees. I don’t withdraw very often to Paypal and i’ve started using payoneer but when i do i still notice that the balance shown in my Fiverr let’s say there was £1000 and then i withdraw to Paypal and it shows as for example £980.75. Why is this if there are no Paypal fees?
reply_text:
The paypal fee if you’re converting the currency is usually 3.5%, though this varies depending on which currency you’re converting the dollars to.
The bank transfer fee is $3 + 2%.
So, for $200- paypal costs $7, and bank tranfer costs $7 also.
For $100- paypal costs $3.5 dollars, bank transfer is $5.
For $300- paypal costs $10.5, bank transfer is $9

thread_text: I got four ticket pending, but fiverr support isn’t helping. its been 22 days since I created ticket but look like no one at home. Buyer keep screwing my profile but fiverr support look like isn’t there. What Should I do? Maybe Fiverr owner reduced staff for keep more earning to himself. I’m planing to leave this site, if a level one seller can’t get help imagine situation of new seller
reply_text:
Yes, Fiverr support does exist.
However, the number of sellers is now two to three times as many as before the pandemic.
As a result, there are also sellers that seem to not read TOS and the advice on the Fiverr Forum of what NOT to do.
All of the above contribute to Customer Service taking much longer to respond.
eclixo:
I got four ticket pending, but fiverr support isn’t helping.
Are all of your tickets about the same issue?
Because if they are then I would not expect an answer at all from CS. On this forum, I have read that CS ignores any service request that is filed more than once. They merely send all of the requests to their spam folder.

thread_text: I got four ticket pending, but fiverr support isn’t helping. its been 22 days since I created ticket but look like no one at home. Buyer keep screwing my profile but fiverr support look like isn’t there. What Should I do? Maybe Fiverr owner reduced staff for keep more earning to himself. I’m planing to leave this site, if a level one seller can’t get help imagine situation of new seller
reply_text:
If the 4 tickets indeed are all about the same issue, I would mark 3 of them as solved myself (that’s possible), so they get closed, and add any relevant info that those 3 had to the 1 that’s still active then.
If they are all about different issues, I’d choose the most important one and politely ask if they got around to looking into the issue yet, I think after 22 days, that’s okay. Also, in that case, maybe try to figure out if there is anything you can do yourself to prevent issues; if four buyers at about the same time “screw your profile”, maybe there is something you could do, like being clearer in your gig description, your inbox communication, or whatever may have led to the issues.

thread_text: Hi everyone. So i initiated a withdrawal from fiverr through PAYPAL and i got an email from paypal to claim my money. At that time my kyc for receiving local and global payments was not submitted and they said its not verified. (I messaged the paypal cs). Also i got an email from paypal saying they are waiting for me to submit a few missing documents inorder to deposit the fund(the kyc and i got to know it only after a lot of researching). And if its not verified the fund gets reversed to the sender(FIverr) in 1 month time. The problem is i have submitted all my kyc after this email and after 2 days from my withdrawal initiated. Now the Paypal asks me to contact fiverr and resend the payment once again, Which i dont know how it becomes possible. This is my first paypal transaction and would appreciate it if anybody has the solution to this. Fiver earnings shows withdrawal initiated and deducted the money- The paypal button is greyed out showing withdrawal in progress- the WITHDRAWN tab has $0 as it doesnt display the amount withdrawn which i think is due to the incomplete transaction. The only solution i see as of now is wait for 30 days to reverse the fund in fiverr again and then initiate withdrawal again. Is there anything i am missing here or can anything else be done to receive my money sooner before this 30 day wait as im in urgent need of it. I’d appreciate if anybody can help. Thanks
reply_text: N/A

thread_name: Creating a new gig based on another gig by copying or duplicating it?
thread_text:
Hi,
Does anyone know whether it is technically possible to create a new gig based on another one, so as to save time and work?
I have a gig for fiction book editing (in Hebrew), and I want to create an essentially identical one for non-fiction book editing. It would be great to have the first gig copied and saved as a new one, then make the necessary changes.
Any ideas if this is possible?
If not, do you think Fiverr will consider adding such an option?
Thanks,
Tomer
reply_text:
There is no “duplicate” option on Fiverr - in fact, Fiverr prefers gigs to be completely different from each other.
However, specifying in the title and url that one is fiction and the other is non fiction should be sufficient to differentiate them from each other.
But you’ll have to make sure the both have different descriptions and subtitles … otherwise the algorithm will get confused and send them both to the back of search …

thread_name: Creating a new gig based on another gig by copying or duplicating it?
thread_text:
Hi,
Does anyone know whether it is technically possible to create a new gig based on another one, so as to save time and work?
I have a gig for fiction book editing (in Hebrew), and I want to create an essentially identical one for non-fiction book editing. It would be great to have the first gig copied and saved as a new one, then make the necessary changes.
Any ideas if this is possible?
If not, do you think Fiverr will consider adding such an option?
Thanks,
Tomer
reply_text:
You could put it in the suggestions section of the forum but they probably don’t really read that now.
You could have one gig preview or gig edit open in another tab and copy sections from it to paste into the new gig (and then change them).

thread_name: Creating a new gig based on another gig by copying or duplicating it?
thread_text:
Hi,
Does anyone know whether it is technically possible to create a new gig based on another one, so as to save time and work?
I have a gig for fiction book editing (in Hebrew), and I want to create an essentially identical one for non-fiction book editing. It would be great to have the first gig copied and saved as a new one, then make the necessary changes.
Any ideas if this is possible?
If not, do you think Fiverr will consider adding such an option?
Thanks,
Tomer
reply_text: You can’t just duplicate one gig to make another new gig. But If i were you i would copy all the content from 1st gig and then paste them to the new gig making necessary changes like titles, some part of description, pricing, and of course gallery content. This is almost same as duplicating the gig

thread_name: Creating a new gig based on another gig by copying or duplicating it?
thread_text:
Hi,
Does anyone know whether it is technically possible to create a new gig based on another one, so as to save time and work?
I have a gig for fiction book editing (in Hebrew), and I want to create an essentially identical one for non-fiction book editing. It would be great to have the first gig copied and saved as a new one, then make the necessary changes.
Any ideas if this is possible?
If not, do you think Fiverr will consider adding such an option?
Thanks,
Tomer
reply_text:
Thank you all, this is most helpful information for me. I had no idea that doint overly-similar gigs will result in bad rating in the search engine.
Actually, the idea of splitting fiction from non-fiction book editing only came to me from the incessant prompts to update my gigs and to fill out all possible information. So I was prompted to specify which kind of book I offer to edit. So it was either “generic” or just one of the two (fiction/non-fiction), which was why I then decided to split them.
It frankly seems to me a little unfair to set up the system like this, but will now be better equipped to dealing with it (after your advice).
I do find it would be helpful if duplicating would be made possible as a basis for further changes as we are all working people and this will save up quite some time. But so be it…
Thank you and a great weekend
T.

thread_name: Fiverr funds not showing in clearing amount section
thread_text:
Yesterday I delivered a $50 order. My client accepted and gives a rating so the order shows completed but the amount is not showing under the clearing funds section.
I have completed 19 orders which are $505 and after deduction, it should be $404 but Fiverr shows the net income is $364.
May I know it is a bug or something done by my client?
reply_text:
I have the same issue with my $30 order.
There was a technical glitch on the website yesterday, and it seems several orders were affected.
I don’t have problems with new orders. They moved to the clearance section immediately.
Right now, I’m waiting for an answer from support.

thread_text:
Hello Everyone!
It’s been a while being level 1 seller on fiverr and i’m super excited. But, on the other side, i kinda feel insecure like fear of losing what i earn now. What if i lost my account due to some fraud on the fiverr. Today someone messaged me and asked for $200 and i was threatened that if i don’t pay he will report me. Yeah i obviously reported and blocked him but now i’m feeling a bit insecure and don’t know what to do. I don’t wanna lose my achievements.
reply_text: contact CS with Screen shot, as proved…

thread_text:
Hello Everyone!
It’s been a while being level 1 seller on fiverr and i’m super excited. But, on the other side, i kinda feel insecure like fear of losing what i earn now. What if i lost my account due to some fraud on the fiverr. Today someone messaged me and asked for $200 and i was threatened that if i don’t pay he will report me. Yeah i obviously reported and blocked him but now i’m feeling a bit insecure and don’t know what to do. I don’t wanna lose my achievements.
reply_text:
As long as you don’t break the rules, you should be OK.
You don’t lose your account over crooks talking crap. You lose it over things you do, such as too many forced cancellations due to lateness, insulting customers, and other serious and repeated TOS violations after several warnings.

amar_shah:
and i was threatened that if i don’t pay he will report me.
And for that you need to know the rules if you would’ve know the rules you wouldn’t even bother to worry that someone will report you when they are the ones breaking rules.
Just read terms of services and you wouldn’t be scared anymore because you will know the rules and when you are or wrong. Fiverr doesn’t punish you if someone reported you but you haven’t done anything wrong

thread_text:
Hi, suddenly today, my response rate drop 100% to 93%.
I don’t know why. My response time is 1 Hour. I replied to every message I get. I checked my spam message too. I checked all option to check is there I miss something.
But, there is nothing. I replied to all of the buyers since I open my account.
So, is it Fiverr bug or anything else?
I post in forum because I want to make sure before contacting CS.
reply_text:
Hi @adnanmahmud,
Even-though you replies to all messages you get, Fiverr calculates the time from a buyer starts a conversation with you, to the moment that you are going to reply him/her.
So basically, even if you reply them all, if you take more time more than hour, that is labelled as a “late reply”.

thread_text:
Hi, suddenly today, my response rate drop 100% to 93%.
I don’t know why. My response time is 1 Hour. I replied to every message I get. I checked my spam message too. I checked all option to check is there I miss something.
But, there is nothing. I replied to all of the buyers since I open my account.
So, is it Fiverr bug or anything else?
I post in forum because I want to make sure before contacting CS.
reply_text:
lexisdesigns:
if you take more time more than hour, that is labelled as a “late reply”.
I don’t think you understand what I said here. My response time is 1 Hour. I believe It is the best possible response time.
Here I said about my response rate.
Fiverr said we have to response 90% of our enquiries we receive in the last 60 days to achieve the level.
So, I responded 100% of enquiries I received.

thread_text:

reply_text:
Hi @adnanmahmud,
If your spam folder is empty and you’re sure you have replied within 24 hours to all new messages, then please contact CS asking them to kindly look into it and restore your response rate.
Keep in mind that you’ll need to wait for them to get back to you, since right now they’re taking up to 10 days to reply. So, please, just place one single ticket and wait for their response.

thread_text:
We are currently experiencing a problem preventing you from seeing your Gigs’ impressions, clicks, and views. But not to worry, your Gigs are active. Fiverr’s Dev team is aware of the bug and is working on a resolution. Thank you for your patience.
You can share your experience or post an update on this in this thread.
Edit on :
June 2, 2020 (Dhaka)
We already have 500+ replies regarding this issue, Fiverr Dev Team working on it to fix. Unless Fiverr fixes the issue, there isn’t anything we can do. For now, the thread is closed for any new reply, For detailed information please read the entire thread, a lot of information/experience already shared here.
Edit: The issue is resolved.
If you still do not see the fix, please log out, try clearing cookies, and logging back in. If that still doesn’t work, please contact support with your information.
~ Read This.

reply_text:
From 2 sales in March and 3 sales in April to 0 since this bug occurred.
I know that the current situation in the world might cause that but I can’t understand why did I stop receiving any message? In March and April combined I received around 40-50 messages and, as I said, since this problem started I haven’t got a single message.
And when I search my gig sometimes it’s on the last page and other times I can not even find it.
Spamming “thank you” in every topic about this bug won’t help anyone.
We have to make Fiverr the best place for freelancers together and pointing out to the issues is one step closer to that goal.
Please don’t unpin this topic as you did with the last one.
We need everyone’s voice to be heard!
@wp_kid

reply_text:
There is no such thing as “rank” in the search results. Your gigs are not “ranked” on the last page. That’s just where you see them showing up right now.
If you want more orders, perhaps now is a good time to learn how to market and promote your services, on your own, to the target customers who need your services. Fiverr does not guarantee sales just because you have gigs on Fiverr, and they don’t guarantee that a seller’s gigs will show up in the search results where they/you want them to show up.
It is unwise to expect Fiverr to bring you all your sales, or to make you successful. That’s your job, and yes, it will require marketing, promotion, and not sitting back and waiting for things to happen. If things aren’t working out the way you want them to, try different things. Experiment until you find something that achieves the results you seek.

reply_text:
If the numbers were there in the place (eg. place in the database) the website code is using/used to retrieve them the values would show on the analytics page. But they don’t/didn’t. Before they changed the website code to show “N/A” for everything, the most recent few days were showing 0 for everyone. So the most recent days totals were getting either stored as 0 or null or not being stored at all in the place in the db the analytics page looks (reads) to show them, and still are likely not (otherwise they’d have removed the code that shows “N/A” in every field). So I don’t really think it’s just a “display issue”. ie. the more recent figures are wrong somewhere in the database (even if they’re right/stored in some other place).
So I’d say the correct daily totals for clicks etc. can’t be stored in the database currently for the days since it went wrong (started showing 0 for everyone). But it’s possible that there’s another table/file where the values needed to create those daily totals and that that is working okay (though it’s strange that it’s not been fixed so far).

tarou_yamada:
I don’t see how this “fanboy” attitude helps anyone.
He has his opinion that people should do things to try to improve their gigs and situation on their own. There is some merit in that. I realize people seem to be in a panic right now.
As I said, every time someone on the forum is saying their gigs have disappeared:
they are delivering orders currently or have orders in their queue
or
They cannot find their own gigs since they don’t know how to search for them.
I haven’t tried looking at people’s gigs for everyone who complains, only about 6 sellers. I did find one who was correct that his gigs were not on the first four pages.
The rest had their gigs displayed and I found them within less than ten seconds.
So it’s easy to become jaded or untrusting of what people are reporting due to things like that.

reply_text:
bodmas:
Please @jonbaas if you know you are not affected by this, just stop posting same thing on every topic about “Nothing wrong with algorithm” you are not part of support team or Fiverr staff…
I am affected by this – and have been many times over the past few years. This is nothing new, and it does not stop a good seller from being successful. I have learned how to work withing the system, and I have learned how to overcome the obstacles. I am trying to help other people think for themselves, and learn to overcome these obstacles as well.
Just because the loud voices, that like to complain, don’t want to listen, doesn’t make me wrong, or the facts untrue. This is nothing new. The algorithm is working, and it is normal for gigs to rotate – and yes, move to the last page from time to time. This has happened to me half a dozen times or more over the past few years, and my gigs have always rotated back over time.
Be patient, learn to adapt, and please stop complaining as if this is the end of the world. It isn’t.
Wisdom comes from listening and learning. Be wise and listen.

Regarding This issue got answer from fiverr CS … Hope will be helpfull for everybody.
We’re working on getting your Gigs’ impressions, clicks, and views back online. No worries - your Gigs are active, and all the metrics are calculated as usual.
Dan | Team Lead (Fiverr Customer Support)
May 14, 2020, 3:30:19 AM EDT
Hello there,
Thank you for reaching out. We’re currently experiencing a display issue with gig impressions, views and clicks. The numbers are still being calculated properly, and we’re working to resolve this issue. This is happening for all sellers on Fiverr.
Currently there is no estimated time of the resolution but rest assured that it’s in our best interest to resolve this as quickly as possible.
Thank you for your patience and understanding.

reply_text:
Nothing is any different now than it has been over the past few years. The search results are working exactly as Fiverr appears to intend them to work. There is no 50-70% of people affected. This it normal, this is the way things work on Fiverr. There is no need to try to find a reason, or something to blame, because NOTHING is wrong with the algorithm.
Just because you (or anyone else) claim there’s a problem, doesn’t mean there is. Just because your gigs (or those of others) have entered rotation, does NOT mean that something is broken.
Please stop blaming Fiverr, or the system, for your failure to adapt to normal changes.

reply_text:
Hi all! As you all I am facing the same issue. My gig was on the first page and now I can’t even find it in first 10 pages. No new clients no new messages. Then I messaged fiverr team and they told me my gig is totally fine. So I was really confused by not knowing what actually happened. Then I thought I should act positively.
If fiverr says they are working on it, surely they will be doing so. We have nothing to do with that. I don’t remember they waited us this much in the past few years. They might be facing some practical issues in this pandemic. That might be the reason for taking it this longer.
So these are the things I did
I update all my gigs again. Then I found out some gigs have lack of keywords and some have unwanted and wrong keywords
And I saw that fiverr has given a new place to put your “SEO TITLE”. Some of you might know about this already. If not, please go and update your SEO TITLE today.
Then I update the FAQ for many of my gigs. I hope it might help your client to understand your service much better.
Here is the most important thing. I saw my gig description works fine on desktop but not on mobile devices. Some of my gigs didn’t have spaces between paragraphs when it comes to mobile view. But it was totally fine in desktop view. We all know now everybody uses mobile. So this will have a real effect in your gigs.
Also, I take few fiverr tests related to my service. So I could verify few of my skills
And one last thing I did was, I spent a few bucks on “Learn from fiverr” tutorials related to my service to upgrade my skills. I must say these tutorials are Amazing. Specially tutorials from Mr. Daniel Walter Scott was excellent. I invite you to watch these tutorials and you will thank me one day. Also, you will get few badges at the end as a bonus and they will be displayed on your profile forever.
So these are the things I did in this bad situation. Because I thought doing something is better than waiting. Let’s hope for the best

mattheweveringh:
They’re either lying or wrong, lots of high level sellers have noticed it, whether you like it or not it IS having an impact

We don’t know what the difference has been for buyers, sellers and orders (though I thought there was a poll recently where most people who voted said their sales had decreased).

reply_text:
mattheweveringh:
but you don’t know any better than anyone else
No, I don’t. What I do know is that I’m getting more sales than I did in April (or March, February, January…). And I’m not the only one.
mattheweveringh:
i know it’s odd people say they had dozens of messages daily or weekly and now have none
I don’t know for how long you’ve been on Fiverr forum, but every now and then, there is a number of sellers (not always the same sellers, of course) who complain about the exact same thing, and it’s been like that for years, when the problem with displaying metrics didn’t exist.
mattheweveringh:
I don’t see why all of these people are “a loud group” when some are top sellers.
I call them the loud group because there’s always a loud group complaining about not getting sales, and because they keep saying the same thing, you get the impression that their number is huge, even though there are sellers who keep getting sales (but they don’t come to the forum to repeatedly say that). And level has nothing to do with it, top sellers can suddenly stop getting sales, too.
Now the ones who are not getting sales are even louder than usual, probably because of the pandemic panic.

reply_text:
sameed_webdev:
It’s working for you Great. Isn’t working for many of Us That’s it.
I experience the same things all the loud voices are complaining about right now. I am not immune just because I am a Fiverr veteran. The search algorithm affects us all equally. The difference is, I work with the system, instead of complaining when it doesn’t do what I want or make me more visible than someone else. There are thousands of people who want to be on the first page of search results, but there isn’t room for them on that page. This is why the system rotates all gigs (based upon internal factors we do not need to know about).
If you are rotated “to the last page”, be patient, and you will likely be rotated back. This has happened to me many times over the past few years. Yes, it happens to me, and no, I am not complaining about it over and over here on the forums – like the current loud voices are.
This is how the search algorithm works.
sameed_webdev:
We aren’t getting any response from Buyers .
It is a terribly irresponsible concept to expect the Fiverr search system to work in your favor, and provide you with all of your orders. If you aren’t getting the kind of orders you want from the search system, then please take responsibility for your own success, and market and promote your gigs to your target customers – on your own – wherever they may be located. All businesses have to do this. Here on Fiverr, you are a businessman too, so I don’t understand why hard self-motivated work doesn’t apply to the loud voices here, on the forums?
Fiverr says the search system is working like it should. This clarification is clearly posted on everyone’s Gigs page. As Fiverr clearly states, the analytics display error has nothing to do with gigs being active, and functioning properly, within the search system.
sameed_webdev:
Kindly Take into consideration what others are going through.
I am well aware of the nature of the complaints being voiced here. Complaints, however, do not equal truth, especially when Fiverr has clearly spelled out the nature of the error (and it’s connection to anything else). Complaining about something that Fiverr says is not broken, is not going to result in the search system being changed to adhere to the demands being voiced here.
Please be patient. The analytics DISPLAY ERROR will be fixed when Fiverr fixes it.

reply_text:
vidvox:
more than 100+ Peoples Complaining on forum that There gig is not appearing on search
Please share your source for this number of people complaining. I’ve been around, here on the forums for years, and it doesn’t look like any more people now, than those who are usually complaining about this sort of thing in the past. The issue is a DISPLAY error. It has nothing to do with a gig’s ability to perform. As Fiverr states – clearly – on everyone’s Gigs page, all gigs are still gaining analytics, those analytics just aren’t being DISPLAYED. Gigs and the algorithm are working just fine.
vidvox:
Because Like me Many Other Peoples Follow Gig Analytics Page Because its Really Helps us a lot to check How Our Gigs are performing.
I don’t know. It sounds, to me, like many sellers are addicted to seeing stats, and they have come to believe that the stats guarantee them success. The analytics stats are just numbers. Success does not depend upon those numbers. Success depends upon the ACTIONS sellers take, and, as far as I’ve seen, most of the sellers complaining about the display error, are also the same sellers that aren’t taking any productive ACTIONS to become successful.
Analytics stats will not guarantee success. Sitting around and watching numbers rise and fall won’t result in profitable gigs. Stop staring at the numbers, and start doing research, promotion, marketing, experimentation, taking risks, etc.
You don’t to know your on-site impressions in order to build your business.

My Question is Very Simple . Like You and 2 Other Persons in this forum , You are Saying Stats are Useless and This is Just a Display Issue . Now If That option is hurting many sellers like me its our Right to ask fiverr to resolve this issue. My argument is not with you and I Have not started this with you. reply_text:
wolfhowler:
I think people are obsessed with their stats.
I think there’s a big difference between being ‘obsessed’ with stats, and ‘interested’ in stats, yet a lot of the responses I’ve read on this thread suggest that even having a passing interest in stats is foolish and a waste of time. I simply can’t wrap my head around that way of thinking.
Do you need stats to sell? No, of course not. Just like you don’t need money to be happy. But it helps, right? Stats help you to make decisions about your business based on actual metrics, as opposed to speculation.
The metrics in Fiverr are woefully bad as-is. I’d love to know what keywords drove buyers to our gigs. I’d love to know which demos buyers listened to - how many times on average a buyer visited our gig before buying etc etc… All of these are metrics we could be shown, whilst still maintaining buyer privacy, and they would give us actionable insight to make changes to our gigs with.
The fact that Fiverr can’t even give us the absolute basic stats, for almost a month now, is the reason why people, myself included, get frustrated.

Edit on :
June 2, 2020 (Dhaka)
We already have 500+ replies regarding this issue, Fiverr Dev Team working on it to fix. Unless Fiverr fixes the issue, there isn’t anything we can do. For now, the thread is closed for any new reply, For detailed information please read the entire thread, a lot of information/experience already shared here.
Edit: The issue is resolved.
If you still do not see the fix, please log out, try clearing cookies, and logging back in. If that still doesn’t work, please contact support with your information.
~ Read This.

reply_text:
wolfhowler:
Well you say why can’t Fiverr trust all sellers.
With respect, you’ve paraphrased me a little there. What I said was that most of us will do the right thing, and for those who don’t, punishments exist to discourage bad behaviour, and I was referring only to being able to see some basic metrics related only to our own gigs, not giving out my username and password to random strangers, which is why I said we’re not quite comparing the same thing.
For clarity, my two pence on this is that Fiverr could and should give us more, higher quality metrics to work with. As Fiverr grows and evolves as a business (now an NYSE listed company, not some tin-pot freelance site), and as we all grow as sellers, why can’t we understand a little more about customer behaviour behind the scenes, when it’s related to our own gigs? That’s evolution. Exploitation will always happen, that’s what sensible risk-mitigation, rules and punishments exist for.
That’s my opinion, nothing more, and I totally get and respect that a number of people disagree with me.

reply_text:
wolfhowler:
I’m not saying this is the right thing to do, I do agree statistics are important to help improve marketing and understand business needs. But possibly Fiverr has a different goal.
Absolutely agree with you. But something that I feel often gets missed in conversations, is that Fiverr has two sets of customers - the ones who buy the products, and the ones who pay the seller fees. We’re customers of Fiverr too, just a different type. It’s a cliche, but it’s true; without sellers there would be no Fiverr.
And for all the enormous improvements that buyers have seen in the way they interact with the Fiverr platform over the years, I feel that we as sellers haven’t seen quite the same level of improvements.
I’m hopeful that will change, and I’m excited about the Promoted Gigs feature that’s hopefully launching soon. It would make sense to bundle some new metrics in with that, so who knows?

reply_text:
jobtheilstrator:
Then why is that so many people complaining about it?Please stop saying it is not a problem…
People are complaining because they think the analytics display issue is related to a gigs activity in the search results and this is not true. Fiverr has said exactly this.
Those who are complaining merely because they cannot see their analytics (which are still being calculated, just not shown), have a valid complaint. Those who are complaining that they think their gigs are failing because of the analytics display issue, are merely wasting time. The two things are not related. By Fiverr’s own statement, the analytics display issue has nothing to do with gigs in the search system. I will continue to remind people that there is no search results problem, until Fiverr specifically says otherwise. I am expressing the truth, as we know it. It is not your place to demand that I do otherwise.

celebrawitch:
My point is that my sales have been really good since I started my fiverr account and they dropped at the same time Fiverr stopped showing gig impressions. Obviously I am going to think there is a correlation and so will others who are having that same issue.
And, obviously, based upon what Fiverr has said, that would be a wrong assumption.
celebrawitch:
If you aren’t having any problems and doing so well with your business, why do you have so much time to spend on the forums when the problem doesn’t even concern you?
I choose to be here, and I choose to dedicate some of my time each day to help others. I also stand against misinformation – as I have, on the forum, for years. Just because I am successful with my sales, does not mean I should stop interacting here. My continued hope is that there are people who ARE willing to listen to reason, wisdom, and my expert advice… and those who listen can become as successful as I, and other veteran sellers, have become.
In fact, over the years, many sellers have thanked me for sharing my advice and insight here on the forums. I am honored to have been a part of the success many other former new sellers are now experiencing. If YOU don’t want to listen, that’s fine… clearly you don’t want to be helped right now.
celebrawitch:
Perhaps you shouldn’t give unsolicited advice when you don’t even know someone’s situation.
That’s the thing, though, in large part, I DO know the situations of most who are complaining. I’ve been here for years, and I have seen just about everything. I have also experienced what the loud voices are complaining about, and I have learned from those experience. It would be wonderful it those who are complaining about things that aren’t even true, would stop and look at the situation objectively, and realize that what they are doing is expending needless energy that could be better invested in becoming better sellers.
celebrawitch:
I did not need your patronizing reply.
And I, respectfully, don’t need you to be telling me not to stand up for reason, and voice an alternate perspective of things. This is a discussion forum… a civil discourse. If you want to believe what isn’t true, that’s fine, but it is not appropriate for you to say that I cannot oppose that misinformation.
I’m here to help those who are willing to listen.

Fiverr says the system is working, and gigs are still interacting in the system as they are supposed to… It is not broken merely because some sellers currently have their gigs in rotation, and don’t like it. I’ve had my gigs in rotation many times too, and yet, here I am… finding ways to earn sales. My gigs have bounced back numerous times. Yours will too.
bodmas:
what are you trying to achieve or your aim?
I have explained my aim in my previous post.
bodmas:
You expect Fiverr to say there is a search results issue till you believe…
I trust Fiverr, because there is no reason not to. Even when things aren’t going my way, I work on my gigs, I market, I promote, and I do what I need to do to remain relevant and successful. Complaining achieves nothing. Actions to better a struggle do.
bodmas:
anytime I see your response on any post, I feel somehow…
Very well. Be emotional. That doesn’t, however, make you right, when Fiverr has already stated the nature of the situation, and that it does not affect what you and others are complaining about.

Hi guys, I’m really sad of what’s happening right now and I am affected by this as well its been 3 months of my gig improving then suddenly it went down to 0 impressions on april 28 and I get no messages or orders after this bug, but we can stop arguing about this, I’ve asked one my top rated seller friend, he’s been on fiverr since 2012. I’ve asked him if its a natural rotation or really a bug, because the rotation happened at the same time the gig analytics went offline. I’m still in doubt but I trust my friend about this, he said there’s a time that our gig will be on the last page for maybe a month, but it’ll go back as it is, and fiverr will give you a chance to shine again. I hope this comment will help ease my fellow freelancers. and I hope we can get back to the track as soon as possible. Cheers to us! and Godbless to us all.
P.S FOR THOSE WHO WANTS TO HELP, HELP BY MAKING OUR FELLOW FREELANCERS FEEL AT EASE, NOT MAKE IT WORSE BY SAYING THEY’RE BAD IN ADVERTISING/PROMOTING!

reply_text:
I track the stats for the month after I’ve made changes to my gig, including sales. Increased stats tend to lead to increased sales, decreased stats tend to lead to decreased sales, obviously. While sales are the best metric, my gig is rather niche, so I don’t get them all that often; that being the case, the stats are a quicker metric of interest in my gig and allow me to fine tune prices and packages more rapidly.
More impressions = more interest = more sales.

reply_text:
I entered your title of your first gig into the search bar. Here are a few observations of the gigs on the first page:
Only 3 are level 2 sellers
Only 5 are level 1 sellers
6 are Pro sellers
the rest are level 0 sellers – that’s 31 sellers are level 0 on the first page
On the second page, 35 are level 0 sellers
There are 12,868 level 0 sellers and only about 4,200 level 1 and 2 combined.
So there are an overwhelming number of new sellers or level 0 sellers compared to the rest. If anyone’s gig comes up on the first or second page they have truly won the lottery.

reply_text:
I’m new to the Forum and created my first gig a few months ago. There are a lot of opinions about what is going on, so rather than sharing my opinion I’ll share my experience.
I originally saw my impressions drop to 0 randomly after having climbed up to around 90 a day beginning around the 28th of April.
I have had my most productive month-long period so far from halfway through April to about a week ago, with 27 orders overall and around 13 inquiries per day. I was getting so many orders that I marked myself as “out of office” for the better part of a week and a half to slow down. When I came back, my first day began with about 4 new inquiries and nothing else. Since then, I have received absolutely nothing, no messages or orders from new buyers (I’ve had two messages from returning buyers but no orders).
That is my experience. I’ve found my gig on the very last page of search results for about a week, so it’s searchable, but almost impossible to find.
As for my opinion, I want to believe it’s the system glitching but I’m just not sure. I heard there was a gig rotation around the same time so it might just be that. Nevertheless, I feel like an international company should be able to have fixed this glitch within a few days, let alone a month. Being new to Fiverr, I’m really not in much of a position to criticize, but I really hope this is a fluke and not how Fiverr normally operates, keeping us all in the dark like this.
If anyone more experienced has info on how Fiverr normally works it would be much appreciated! Have a great day/night everyone

reply_text:
Hi Fiverr Team,
I am a bit confused by how you handle this issue. As you can imagine, displaying gig statistics is quite an important functionality for any fiverr seller on your platform. You even promote it as one of the basic functionalities of fiverr in your eLearning videos. And this is sure true as interpreting and reacting to gigs analytics data may have direct impact on the received orders.
Mistakes can happen and problems pop up every now and then in any company but I am left rather speechless how you handle this incident.
First, there is no transparent communication on this issue beside this orange box, which is telling the obvious, i.e. that the gigs statistics are not displayed and that you are working on it. But common, you have a blog, why not use it to communicate with your customers? Why are the gigs stats down? Have you been hacked? Did someone press delete accidentally? Did a server go down? How is the progress of fixing the issue so far? Anything?!
Instead people have to search through the forums for a thread, which is not even marked sticky, but people actually have to search for it. On top, the thread basically says the same as the orange box and is flooded by repeating questions of your customers. This is a pretty bad communication Fiverr team.
Moreover, asking in the forums, I was merely pointed to this thread, which doesn’t provide any information at all, instead of answering my questions, which are rather legit to most of us. On top, without having a chance to reply my thread was closed? Pretty strange way of addressing legit requests of your customers.
I hope you can use this current challenge to heavily improve the way you communicate incidents with your customers.
Happy to receive your feedback.
Cheers,
André

Fiverr is a publicly held company. How the site is run is a subject that is not to be made public. Internal decisions on any changes to the site are not going to be announced.
We sellers have to work with the changes that come along and do the best we can.

Hi @misscrystal,
thanks! Actually, it is not about sharing secrets at all. it is about communication. Incident response and incident response communication are standard processes of any company. It is not a binary decision to either publicly disclose non-secret data or not disclose anything because internal processes might be affected. In both cases, transparent communication is key.
I am not saying that the public should decide how the side is run. It is really just about communicating issues that affect the platform as a whole to its customers. I think this is a basic process for any company like mentioned above.
Best,
André

reply_text:
Thanks for further looking into the situation. I’m in complete agreeance with you. As a Level 2 Seller with 200+ reviews on this specific gig alone, it doesn’t seem logical (or fair but we won’t go into that) that “randomly” my Best Selling gig would lose it’s search authority to instead preference gigs with limited credibility.
I read one post that possibly they’ve skewed the algorithm to favor new Sellers amidst the COVID-19 crisis? While in a way I understand the logic, I too spent nearly a year putting my blood, sweat and tears into creating something sustainable out of this gig - proving my capabilities, commitment to customer service, etc.
If this is an intentional shift in the algorithm, it is disappointing that Fiverr would do wrong by loyal Sellers, who too are struggling through this humanitarian and economic crisis. May I ask if this is an issue you might recommend inquiring further with customer service about? I’ve tried politely, but receive a blanket response re: display issue. Thanks again for your time.

reply_text:
I feel I need to share something positive in this bad mood topic.
I don't know what's happening, but I like it
Your Fiverr Experience
I am a 15 year old web developer, I started my Fiverr account in March and I got my first order 1 week later. Until May I got an order every ~2 weeks, which was still good for me. But this month something happened. My orders skyrocketed. I get at least 4 messages a day. Most of them buy my gig and I’ve been able to raise my prices. In May until now I earned about 200$. It’s become quite overwhelming and I had to pause my gigs until I get the current active orders done. All in all, I’m very glad …

reply_text:
Thanks so much for the compliment!
Honestly, I rarely change it, and I know that causes me to drop back in rankings. When I do though, it’s important for me to see how that affects changes in the long run as, like I said, my gig is niche. I understood that going in. The only thing I can use to evaluate the interest (note that I’m not saying success) is in analytics, as my sales aren’t frequent enough to give good data.
I wonder if this whole argument is just the difference in perspectives. For those who have a steady stream of sales, the analytics page is essentially useless. You know sales are going to come in and your gig is running like a well-oiled machine; what’s the point of checking impressions, then?
For those who don’t expect many sales (like me), the analytics data actually serve a role as they’re an important indicator of interest. I only get a few sales a month, which I’m fine with, so I need to rely on other indicators for gig performance. They’re not perfect, but it generally helps me predict if a sale is coming or if my ads on other sites are actually driving traffic to my gig.
Of course, there are plenty of new recruits who are using analytics as a source of hope, and that’s where a lot of problems come up, as they’re not entirely reliable and don’t guarantee anything.

markadamsdesign:
For those who have a steady stream of sales, the analytics page is essentially useless. You know sales are going to come in and your gig is running like a well-oiled machine; what’s the point of checking impressions, then?
I totally agree with this. When my gig was getting almost around 2-3 orders a day, I didn’t give my analytics any attention. However, now I haven’t gotten any orders in the past 2 weeks and it would be incredibly useful to see if there was a drop in impressions or the same amount of impressions, just nobody is inquiring (which I could use to adjust my gig accordingly.)
This bug is getting really annoying and I just wish Fiverr would say anything, even if it was just a 5 word update like “We’re still alive and working!” But we’re just getting silence.

reply_text:
tommybmedia:
I haven’t gotten any orders in the past 2 weeks and it would be incredibly useful to see if there was a drop in impressions or the same amount of impressions, just nobody is inquiring (which I could use to adjust my gig accordingly.)
I would hazard a guess that your impressions have gone way down if you stopped getting orders, if you regularly got orders before.
I can tell where my gig is located approximately and how many impressions it gets by how many messages and orders I get.
Impressions are not the whole story since you can get a lot of very low quality impressions, where your gig is actually being displayed, but not in a place anyone is looking for it to buy it.
It’s always possible that you can have lots of impressions without any sales if your gig is shown only to a certain demographic, certain country, certain out of the way place, where it is assured it won’t get sales.
We all would like our gigs to be shown mostly in one or two countries known to represent the most buyers but it’s possible to have it displayed where no one ever wants it also. Fiverr is good at showing impressions where it’s not going to get many sales sometimes as part of it’s rotation.
Fiverr can also slow down sales for you in spite of a lot of impressions by putting the gigs of your competition right on your own gig page.

reply_text:
That was most likely your 60 day average rating. If you hadn’t had any ratings in the last 60 days it would have no ratings to base that 60 day average on so would show “N/A”. After you had a new rating it would base it on that rating and show that as the average, which is why it now shows something there.
Fiverr hasn’t changed anything there. It’s not related to the “N/A” showing in the gig stats for everyone.

reply_text:
You took the words right out of my mouth. With these replies, I could swear that there are 2-3 people getting paid to calm people down because of the panic this bug is creating.
As I said earlier, the gigs stopped rotating and you might be lucky to be on the first or second page when it stopped. However, there are people stuck on the last page.
I receive atleast two messages on Fiverr everyday and ever since this bug started, I have received 0. 0. I have like 5 friends on Fiverr that the same has happened to. Either their gigs disappeared to the last page or they can’t even find their gigs anymore. On the other hand , you will find gigs with 1 star reviews , 2 star reviews on the first page. And these gigs have been on the first page for weeks now. That would never happen if everything was normal.
Yes you’re lucky, your gigs are working fine because the platform collapsed when you were on the first page or so, but you can’t use your own privileges to downplay what everyone else is going through. That makes no sense at all.
As it has been said repeatedly here, if it was a just a display issue, Fiverr would have solved it in a day. IT IS WAY MORE THAN THAT. The N/A bug has messed up the algorithm but Fiverr won’t tell us that because that will make them lose people.
Waking up to see replies dismissing everyone’s claims as “illogical” or just replying with “Fiverr has already said it doesn’t affect so it doesn’t ” make me sick.

reply_text:
My gig used to receive 3-4 orders with 80-100 views everyday, a few months back Fiverr even contacted me to help them with creating a whole new category since I was and still am one of the top sellers within the Tattoo Design category.
Ever since the gig analytics crashed I have had a maximum of 4 clicks on my gig per day and I have gotten an eighth of the orders that I usually get.
I understand that this is not a large amount of people and I am not asking for any type of special treatment. I would just like to add to the obvious evidence that can be found in the forum already.
I have worked extremely hard to gain momentum on this platform, just like many other sellers here that are experiencing the same problem. The customer support service needs to address this problem and give their sellers the respect that they deserve.

reply_text: There are number of factors. Many new sellers joined Fiverr because of Covid-19. So this rapid increase changed the algorithm, rankings etc. Many have been affected. thread_text:
We are currently experiencing a problem preventing you from seeing your Gigs’ impressions, clicks, and views. But not to worry, your Gigs are active. Fiverr’s Dev team is aware of the bug and is working on a resolution. Thank you for your patience.
You can share your experience or post an update on this in this thread.
Edit on :
June 2, 2020 (Dhaka)
We already have 500+ replies regarding this issue, Fiverr Dev Team working on it to fix. Unless Fiverr fixes the issue, there isn’t anything we can do. For now, the thread is closed for any new reply, For detailed information please read the entire thread, a lot of information/experience already shared here.
Edit: The issue is resolved.
If you still do not see the fix, please log out, try clearing cookies, and logging back in. If that still doesn’t work, please contact support with your information.
~ Read This.
reply_text:
I appreciate the helping words but I highly doubt that is the issue.
Some people’s gigs are placed on my searches 2-3 times while mine is stuck on the last page. I would also like to mention the fact that I am one of the highest rated sellers in my category.
I don’t think it is logical that a buyer with 0 reviews should be placed on the marketplace 2-3 times before the person that has 350+ 5 star reviews. Anyone that wanted to create a algorithm would see that this is complete chaos.
Fiverr always mentions that hard work brings in more orders. On my gig its the exact opposite. 76 completed orders shouldn’t lead to the orders being cut in half by the next month.

If you can’t see any error/warning on screen maybe reloading the page might help (ctrl f5) or removing cookies and retrying. Maybe try less characters in some of the fields. You could also show the screenshot to CS in a support ticket and see what they suggest.

thread_text:
Maybe you should add a webhook api for fiverr events for business who want their own integration. Some business dont want to share fiverr login and password.
The webhook will forward events such (as a new order), (a new review attached to an order id), (a tip attached to an order id). This would help in areas of tracking which employees had which orders and how well did they perform.
Also a webhook should add for a message forwarding with the associated order id. So that i can forward the message to my employee on our own private software. I dont want my employees having my fiverr login password.

reply_text:
Hearing of this buyer abuse experience from established sellers here makes me feel like I don’t stand a chance in Fiverr. I’m a new seller here, after months of not getting orders I finally made a breakthrough and things were looking up. My clients were happy and left fantastic reviews. Then it happened… a 4 star rating from a new buyer which just reduced my overrall rating to 98%. The buyer actually said he liked my work and thinks that I’m an excellent designer blah blah but still left 4 stars for all, communication etc. It just does not make sense, gave no opportunity to me to remedy even. When I asked if there was a problem… the buyer said, no problems just it was not perfect but its ok… What?? sigh Now I am worried he will order again and just keep leaving low ratings just because he feels like it. They don’t understand how Fiver works that reputation really matters here. I still left him a 5 star review as I did not want to indulge in a tit-for-tat loop with buyers generally… in the end I know, I will be the one to suffer. Sadly, there is no option to block future orders from this buyer… so I guess, I will be at their mercy.
I second the motion to block buyers when needed, to afford some protection to Sellers.

saddu_writer:
P.S Create an anonymous poll about who read it whole.
I’m not interested in who doesn’t read the entirety of the content. I’ll be the first to admit that some of my musings are inappropriately long. In the grand scheme of things, it’s just some forum post. It doesn’t need a vote. I’m here often enough that you can choose to skip passed my ramblings if they don’t float your boat.
On the other hand…boy, am I here a lot. I do a lot of back end reading and dig through old posts whenever some random, yet to be researched by me, topic strikes my fancy. Because I’m here so often - I choose to offer a specifically different tonal approach from the traditionally condensed forum offerings.
I’d hope that the forum mainstays… people that spend a large portion of their day hopping in and out of the topics… I hope they view my illogical, never ceasing, head splattering, choose-your-own-adventure narratives as a comedic rest from the barrage of similar topics and retorts.
In the case of this topic, I found it interesting and I agreed. I thought it to be more entertaining if I did so with a story…rather than a “me too.” Either way, my “take” on the issue doesn’t sway any balance or mean a thing more to the issue.
But you did get a Roy Orbison song out of it.

He liked the song, I nailed every detail that he was after and he raved about the quality. The song was mastered to be as loud as any radio material … but different people produce to different volumes.
What I’m saying is, I got a four star rating because the buyer didn’t turn up his speakers.
That happened.

There are some buyers that simply don’t get it. We need a tool to get rid of them and to prevent them from purchasing our gigs or contacting us.
Please. PLEASE. I’m willing to PAY for this feature.
reply_text: Similar experience… seems like rating is a punishment tool for some buyers. In my case, I sent mockups within a few hours of the order for his feedback because I did not want to take any chances on not getting it right. He gave his feedback, I made changes accordingly and delivered just before the 24 hour deadline. He accepted the delivery and did not ask for a revision and just punished me with 4* rating. When I asked why did I get 4*? was there a problem with the files… his reply was " its important for you to understand that the rating does not mean there is a problem, its just not perfect but its ok" I don’t get it, why not just ask for a revision to make it perfect, he had no trouble asking for revisions in the previous order and I would have done it gladly. Let’s face it, ratings/reviews is just an easy way to punish sellers, but that’s always the case in any marketplace where you have to deal with customers. Yes, customer is always right, yes… seller must succumb (for reputation sake), buyer’s gets a freebie or store credit etc, rinse and repeat. It’s just the way it is (unless of course you have Swifty on speed dial) Unfortunately, there is no comeback for a bad review, your ratings take a dive and it stays forever. That is why its so important to block some users, especially when there is harrasment and bullying… Really wish Fiverr protect us sellers too.

reply_text:
macroworth1:
The buyer actually said he liked my work and thinks that I’m an excellent designer blah blah but still left 4 stars for all, communication etc.
We all get a few of those. Don’t stress over a 4 star rating. Just keep building and getting mostly 5 stars. Note that having a 4 star rating actually gives you MORE credibility with some buyers. If you’re new and they are all 5 star, many will assume it’s your friends and family ordering. A 4 star is a real buyer.
Move on: Improve your service, refine your deliveries, and keep getting better at what you do. Most of us can continue to improve, no matter how many 5 star orders we have delivered.
If you get 1 or 2 star ratings more than once every few hundred orders, THEN you have a major issue. Also note: If you do enough, you’ll also get a 1 star rating at some point.
Someone will want something for nothing, and you will not do it, and take the one star because you did the work. You’ll get paid and move on. You want to keep those to maybe one in five hundred. If you don’t have a 1 star, you haven’t done enough.

thread_text:
Well I don’t know I’d anyone else is experiencing this little problem but I thought I should let the techno people know that some of the pages/tabs in the Android app are misbehaving… I just opened the app to read and respond to a review then decided to check my revenues and was greeted by what I think is Spanish (this happened on the desktop browser platform before)… I don’t know if the desktop or iPad app is affected, or any other tabs, and its not a train smash… But it is extremely annoying… I would attach a screen shot but the capability doesn’t seem to be around on the app… Anyways just thought someone should know…
EDIT:
AAANNND an update… I’ve just checked the desktop browser platform and there is a problem with the revenues page (although the language is fine). Usually you have a little countdown bar showing how long it is until the revenue for an order clears but although my ‘pending clearance’ balance at the top is right - there is only a status bar for an order that was marked complete BEFORE the scheduled maintenance a little while ago.
This is a much bigger problem than the language issue because I need to know when I can expect to be able to withdraw funds so that I can schedule the paying of my bills etc. accordingly. And this feature is not available on either of the apps so it is highly frustrating!! Please fix the Revenues page and quickly because I would be very ticked off if it turns out that there is also a problem with the Withdraw feature!!
P.S. There doesn’t seem to be a problem with any other pages/tabs.
reply_text:
Hi there!
To my knowledge this isn’t actually an error but is happening because funds clearing at this point on your account would actually be clearing in the new year - 2017.
As the mobile app defaults to the current year, you wouldn’t see them there.
The desktop has the 2016 filter set by default. Change this to 2017 and you will see the information you require regarding clearing times.
Hope this helps
Regards
Adam

thread_name: Please can we have an option to require buyers to contact before ordering?
thread_text:
I have on my gig, 3 different places where I have in all capitals PLEASE CONTACT BEFORE ORDERING. Still, I get people ordering without contacting me. They just don’t bother.
For me, I am an artist, and I just simply cannot work with certain buyers who are not able to communicate effectively. If the buyer has very weak English, but wants a complex design, there is no way I can make them happy because I don’t understand what they want in their art. Thus I need them to tell me in ADVANCE what they want, and if I don’t understand, I can’t get the job done!
Could we not have an optional button, (not automatic, but something that gets turned on) so that we require buyers to contact in advance. Asking them to do it in the description doesn’t work, they don’t listen.
When I look at other sellers, many have the same “Please Contact before Ordering”. We waste space in our gig description to say this and explain why, when it would be better for everyone if we could use the space to better describe the gig. Fiverr this would mean more sales for you guys, and less cancellations from sellers.
If Fiverr is worried about slowing down the order process, maybe even make this an option for sellers who have proven themselves? Like level two and above? I think you could really make this a better experience for the seller AND the BUYER.
reply_text:
This seems to be requested once a week. Here is a previous request for this but there are many:
Contact before ordering feature
Fiverr Site Suggestions
There are many of us sellers who need to be contacted before an order is placed. And on the other side, there are many buyers who don’t read the gig description and just place an order right away. The result? Cancelled orders, time wasted on both ends, and similar mess. SUGGESTED SOLUTION: The seller could have a CONTACT instead of BUY option on that particular gig where he needs to be contacted. In other words the current BUY button would be replaced by a CONTACT button. So the buyer would…
Fiverr will never implement something that will slow down or prevent buyers from ordering.
The answer might be to have a brief questionaire as a PDF you show on your gigs that they can look at and send you first with large instructions on the top saying to please answer the questions and send them to you before ordering.

I got similar problem before…,
My method is set the gig delivery 1 week.
and on gigs desciption ask them to contact before order to discuss the project and delivery time.
It solve the “sudden order” problem

thread_text:
My response rate just lowered, from 98% to 88%. I respond to every single message, so I don’t understand why it would lower like this. I know it only takes into account the last 30 days, but even messages that someone sent to me and immediately deleted I respond to. I have no unread messages, My response time is 1 hour on average, and have Fiverr on my phone so I know to never miss a client.
It just lowered, so it would have had to have been a client within the last day or two, but nothing. I responded to them all. There were two that I didn’t respond to when I first started, but that was so long ago that it doesn’t even factor in the last 30 days.
So this has to be a bug. Is this happening to anyone else? Or are there ghost messages in my inbox?
reply_text:
Welcome back.
Sometimes those silly spam messages get stuck there if you don’t answer the clock ticks anyway… also after flagging them.
Maybe that could be one of the reasons.

thread_text:
Hi guys,
From few days, I encounter a problem. when I open my Fiverr page I see an alert in the heading section.
This is the alert message :
“”" This page (https://www.five 3…/requests) is currently offline. However, because the site uses Cloudflare’s Always Online™ technology you can continue to surf a snapshot of the site. We will keep checking in the background and, as soon as the site comes back, you will automatically be served the live version. Always Online™ is powered by Cloudflare | [Hide this Aler…"""""
Why i get this. Can anyone please explain
reply_text:
It may be that Fiverr is down in your country, so the content delivery service - cloudflare - is serving a cached version.
Try clearing your cache and seeing if that helps. If not, then you’ll just have to wait until Fiverr sorts it out …

thread_name: Can log in but cannot receive code for new device
thread_text: Hi, I can log in using my details, but I’ve changed my email address and therefore can not get the code to use my new device. Is there any other way I can get back to my records, so I can retrieve the details of the people I previously worked with? Thanks for your help.
reply_text:
This sounds like you purchased account from someone. Why can’t you access your old email?
And if you started new account why do you want people that bought from you before? You are not allowed to contact them anyway. It is against TOS.

thread_name: Can log in but cannot receive code for new device
thread_text: Hi, I can log in using my details, but I’ve changed my email address and therefore can not get the code to use my new device. Is there any other way I can get back to my records, so I can retrieve the details of the people I previously worked with? Thanks for your help.
reply_text:
Hi Marina,
No, it is the other way around. I pay people to design my book covers etc.
The people I refer to are people I have previously bought their services from and I greatly appreciate their work. I can log into my site, but the email I used was from a website that has become defunct and thus my email associated with that domain name does not work anymore. Likewise the machine I used to access Fiverr with is in container storage as I’m currently travelling.
Anyway, surely there must be an alternative way to get my new laptop registered after I have identified myself? This is the simple question, I’m asking. I hope you or someone else can assist me with this.

thread_name: Can log in but cannot receive code for new device
thread_text: Hi, I can log in using my details, but I’ve changed my email address and therefore can not get the code to use my new device. Is there any other way I can get back to my records, so I can retrieve the details of the people I previously worked with? Thanks for your help.
reply_text:
I understand this completely and it is a unique one of a kind situation. Unfortunately, all of this is just your words so the level of honesty is unknown to Fiverr and from their end, it could go both ways (grant you access or delete your profile).
When I log in it gives me multiple options, input password, code, Facebook, Google, sometimes when I am too annoyed to type the password or code I just click on Facebook and it loges me in. I also activated phone activation (they send me code as SMS). So I have multiple options to log in if one fails.
I do not know how many of these backup access options did you activate/set up.
Your only option is to contact CS about your situation and wait until they respond. But the moment you changed your email you should receive a notification on that email address to confirm the change. After that all info should go on that email.
“We’ll send the code via SMS, email, or Fiverr notification.”

thread_name: Can log in but cannot receive code for new device
thread_text: Hi, I can log in using my details, but I’ve changed my email address and therefore can not get the code to use my new device. Is there any other way I can get back to my records, so I can retrieve the details of the people I previously worked with? Thanks for your help.
reply_text: Okay Marina, I understand. I’ll try the FB option, to see if that bypasses the code requirement. It seems strange to me, that when I have my username and password, that it is not sufficient to proceed. I guess their level of security is high. Thanks for your help. Casper

thread_name: Can log in but cannot receive code for new device

reply_text:
cpieters:
I have my username and password, that it is not sufficient to proceed
Well, you should be lucky that is not sufficient. Not so long ago Twitter and other sites were breached and I think 100000 people accounts and passwords were compromised. I even received email with one of my passwords in the subject so it was not a happy day to see that breach. Luckily the password was for sites I really do no care if someone gains access (like CNN, news, things I log in once in two years).
As a designer, I understand the importance of keeping notes on who delivers proper work so you should if you gain acces again take the links in Word or note pad file for safe keeping.
